name: Ropa Tendida
description:
This piece is part of the Andean Myths Collection.

Ropa Tendida is a Chilean saying, similar to "taking out the laundry in the sun" which refers to exposing secrets in a public way.
In a certain way, both myths, legends or popular sayings inhabit similar symbolic spaces, the language itself, those that condition the actions of our tribe, family or society.
This illustration is loosely based on the song "Mala Fama" by the Chilean group Ases Falsos.
